title: Lenovo Yoga 3 (2 GB RAM) 2 GB RAM 16 GB ROM 8 inch with Wi-Fi+4G Tablet (Slate Black)

product_specification.Additional Features: Depth: 7 - 3 mm, Audio Jack, WLAN Support, Usage Time: 20 hrs, AnyPen Technology, 4 Modes (Stand Mode, Hold Mode, Tilt Mode, Hang Mode), Skype, Dual Front Facing Stereo Dolby Atmos
product_specification.USP: 1.3 GHz Quad Core Processor, Android v5.1 (Lollipop) OS, 8 inch HD IPS Display, 8 MP Rotatable Camera
product_specification.Other Camera Features: Auto Focus, 180 Degree Rotating Camera, Gesture Controlled Camera, Selfies
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year on Product & 6 Months on Accessories

product_description.4 Modes: Enjoy this Lenovo Yoga tablet in four different modes - Stand, Tilt, Hang and Hold. Whether you're watching movies, reading articles or editing documents, this device is always comfortable to use.
product_description.Immersive Sound: The Lenovo Yoga 3 tablet is powered by two Dolby Atmos certified front-facing speakers that provide loud, clear and dynamic 3D surround sound output. Enjoy watching movies, playing games and listening to your favourite tracks in immersive sound quality.
product_description.Brilliant Display: Get your entertainment delivered in HD quality on the 20.3 cm (8) IPS display of this device. Whether you're playing games or watching movies, enjoy excellent picture clarity and perfect viewing in any angle on this Lenovo device.
product_description.Long-Lasting Battery: Browse the web, read online articles and stream videos on YouTube on this Lenovo tablet, thanks to the 6200 mAh Li-Ion battery that boasts up to 20 hours of backup. With USB OTG, you can also turn your Yoga 3 tablet into a power bank to charge your smartphone or mp3 player via USB.
product_description.4G LTE Ready: With 4G LTE, you can stream HD movies and videos seamlessly, without loading time. This device also comes with 3G support, Wi-Fi connectivity and Bluetooth.
product_description.Versatile Camera: Explore creative ways to take photos and selfies without compromising on picture quality, thanks to the 180-degree rotatable 8 MP camera. Want to click a selfie quickly? Open and close your hand in front of the camera.
product_description.AnyPen Technology: Interact with your Yoga 3's display with any conductive object as a pen. Now you don't have to hunt for a stylus to quickly take notes on your Lenovo tablet at a meeting, just grab the nearest conductive object and use it as a pen.
product_description.Performance: This Lenovo tablet features a 1.3 GHz Quad Core processor and 2 GB RAM that ensure a smooth and glitch-free performance. It runs on the Android Lollipop 5.1 operating system.
product_description.Storage: Store your favourite apps, photos and music in the 16 GB storage space offered by this Lenovo tablet. You can also expand the storage space up to 128 GB using a microSD card.

review:
I have been a Lenovo fan ever since I started using Lenovo ThinkPad. I was earlier using Lenovo Yoga 8 inches which I have used for more than 2 years and it kept working without any glitches.

So, after my previous Lenovo Yoga stopped working one fine day, I only thought about buying another Yoga tablet. This time it is in Black color with 2 GB RAM.

Technically this product is the best in tablet category and Lenovo has again proved that it does not compromises with the functionality and processing, let it be a laptop or a tab.

Design is very handy, easy to hold and now with single camera, which can be rotated for clicking pictures or taking selfies is a very usability experience. Older version of Yoga tablets selfie camera was not that good.

Black Teflon finish gives a very good feel and holding experience as it does not sweats my hands anymore.

I only have issue with the seller's offer point of view. Last time purchased Lenovo Yoga tab was from a re-seller who gave leather case for Lenovo Yoga tabs (this case costs INR 3000 approx), screen guard and a very good Lenovo Ear Plugs as free accessories.

But this time it was a huge disappointment as no such accessories were provided with the Lenovo Yoga tab.

I would expect such offers to be always included with such products which are hot on shelf.

I will rate 5 for the product and 2 for the seller and offer.

Bought during the Big Billion Day Sale for children study. As always Flipkart / ekart rocks for Good packing, communication and delivery.

As for the tab

Pros:
* Good price (Rs. 11,691) during the Sale for a 2GB RAM configuration (while other sites incl. Lenovo there is only 1GB model).
* Long lasting battery, with 1st time charge lasted 15+ hours of usage (Browsing, reading books)
* Decent screen size 8-inch with IPS display.
* Good design allows for having a Good grip like a book for reading
* Decent Camera and clever design of 180 degrees rotation enables good photos be it for selfie or otherwise
* Versatile design of the stand so you get 4 different ways to position the tablet with out need for a cover to do the job
* Less bloatware so you get a little over 10 GB (10.86GB as system uses 4.84GB) on initial starting the device
* Reasonable response, though not yet installed nay games (as meant for study)
* Supports SIM & 4G LTE (need to get hold of Jio to check 4G LTE)
* Add a 64GB microsd card and you have ample space for be it movies, books, songs...
Cons:
- Though design is good due to the battery the tab turns out to be bit Heavy
- Accessories viz. Cases/Covers - Not much choice and options available be it color, quality.
Not sure if my device had this issue but the device did not have File Explorer preloaded. Had to download ES File Explorer from play store.

I had compared other brands in the 8-inch space and seen their reviews. But finally went for this as it scored well on usability factors (display size, RAM, Battery). No regrets and my kids too are happy, go for it.

Yoga 3 8-inch with 2gb RAM is just awesome.

Compared to Yoga 3 of 1gb, Lenovo done a good upgrade to 2gb.
Multitasking is smooth without any lag.
Battery is superb and Dolby atoms speaker rocks.
Camera is descent. 180` rotating camera is useful in video calls.
Screen resolution is good.
My main usage is watching videos and playing high end games. So far all the games(incl RR3) i played is running smoothly. Watcing videos now is a cool experience with the different modes of display.
Overall I am impressed with this tab.
PS: Flipkart - TBL delivery was good as always

I was in the market for a tablet for a long time. But as you might be aware, the tablet market in India has almost shrunk to the point of non-existence over the past few years. Amazon's fire is a good range of affordable tablets in the American market, but Amazon decided to discontinue it in India sometime in 2014-15. So I was left with very few options to choose from. Apple i-pad mini 2nd generation, great interface but limited usability. Mipad- Xiaomi's beast- but with many complaints from buyers. Samsung's dinosaur configuration tablets. Or one of Lenovo's many tablets across price ranges from ₹5,000-17,000.

After about a couple of months worth internet research, I narrowed my choices down to Lenovo's phab and phab plus, both decent configuration phablets, sized around 7 inches and the Lenovo Yoga tablet 3 8 inch.

The phab lost out because of its bad processor-snapdragon 405, and the phab plus because of its 3500 mAh battery size.

The yoga tablet's 200 range snapdragon processor in nothing to write home about either, but the fact that the overall hardware of the yoga is superior, owing to its position as Lenovo's flagship tablet, makes up for its low end processor.
Add to that the 6000 something mAh battery and the any pen technology, and it easily becomes the most desirable Android tablet in the Indian market today.

Please be aware that the cheaper version of this tablet available on Amazon comes with 1GB RAM, that is also the iteration that you will find on YouTube reviews and elsewhere.

To enumerate the pros and cons-

Pros:
Great screen
Amazing battery
2GB ram ensures that the performance is solid
Any pen technology is useful
Great for movies and internet usage
4g option

Cons:
The touch is too sensitive
Accessories are not easy to find
The CPU is not good enough for high end games
Very heavy

6200 mah battery! Really? Atleast performance wise not so. It's an unmatched tab no doubt at the given price point, but the overall performance is not upto the mark. The user interface is dull. Better download asus launcher for better experience. Specially the Battery as far as 6200 mah is concerned is not that great. Charging is also an issue as it takes almost 5hours to full 100% status. Better use a fast charger( 2amp) available in the market. However multimedia experience is worth the price. Twin firing speaker grills gives such crispy sound you won't require a headset. With a professional headset( sony or Sennheiser) it's pure magical experience to watch a 5.1 sorround movie. Two gb of ram never lets you down, no lagging what so ever. Touch is butter smooth,highly responsive. Jio 4g voice calls and internet works effectively. It's undoubtedly Lenovo's best product till date at given price segment (12,500/- I got). So don't expect the 6200 mah Battery will last forever and buy it without hesitation. For the rest you won't be disappointed!!

I Am Using This Tab for about 6 months . And Now It Have Also Got Android Marshmallow Update . 2 GB Ram Is A Good Option . It Is More Portable Tab 10 Inch Tab . But This Tab Doesn't Support Pokemon Go . All The Other Apps Works Without Any Problem . The Marshmallow Update Shows No Problem In The Tablets Performance . The 8 MP Rotatable Camera Which Shots Well In Bright Light But In Low Light It Is Not So Good . The Battery Performs Very Well . THIS IS A TABLET WHICH IS DEFINITELY WORTH CHECKING OUT .

Superb tablet! I purchased it for 13499 and it's best in this price range smoothly runs all the applications and heavy games too touch is awesome and any pen technology is too fine but Dolby atmosphere is the key features waat a gr8 sound it hay,only disappointment is camera there is low quality pics and videos seems 8mp camera is just like ordinary 4 mp, but with this price I am happy screen is superb if you could compromise camera go for it!

Great product, bought it for Rs. 11500 worth every penny. Smooth touch, Great sound, Good Battery backup. Ideal for eBook readers and professionals.s strongly recommend. RAM is less. So gamers don't choose this one.

Everything fine with this tab except
1. 4G sim of JIO can't be used for calling. Whereas data works but again not smoothly.
same sim works smoothly in other handsets.
2. Though ram is 2GB but while playing mp3 in winamp and surfing net the song hangs.

rest all are positive about this tab.

Gifted the tablet to my daughter on her 6th birthday and she was very happy and excited to open her gift. I was looking for an affordable tablet for my little princess and after doing my research I finalised the Lenova yoga tablet and believe me guys it is worth every rupee you are spending. Cheers!

I have been using this tab now for two years, the basic purpose , is for browsing, skype calls and watching Youtube videos. For the mentioned applications, this tab is perfect . Excellent sound quality, decent camera for a Video call , excellent screen clarity and battery life. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a value for money tab for causal browsing and home use. I, would not be able to comment of the gaming capabilities and the like

I was planning to buy a new tablet for my mother as her old one was of no use now. Had the ipad mini 2 in sight but ios is again a cumbersome thing to operate so eliminated it. As the tablet industry has not kept pace with the mobile industry the options were very less. Than I went through the reviews of this tab and decided instantly that this will be my moms next new tablet.

Buying from Flipkart is so easy and fast. No need to roam around and search for a worthy product. All in all I was really impressed by Flipkart and its seller who has packed the tablet marvelously.

I won't list the specs as flipkart has clearly listed them. my review will be around the performance of the tab and some short comings that I encountered in a day of use.

Pros:
1) Screen clarity is truly nice although as I use a Sony Xperia z5 premium which has a 4k display and a Samsung galaxy s6 edge which has a 2k resolution still I noticed that actually the screen was quite nice for this tab given its price range. although a full hd display would have been so so rocking.
2) The touch sensitivity is really good and it responds to even slightest of touch.
3) The Dolby Atmos speakers are amazing. even better than my last kindle fire hd tablet which too had 2 speakers with dolby atmos. listening to songs is so much immersive with dolby atmos. Kudos to Lenovo for giving such great music experience.
4) Just as I did the initial setup it prompted for new system update and voah now it is marshmallow version of android. I also was able to register my 128gb sd card as internal memory which is a great feature of Marshmallow. Kudos to Lenovo again and their commitment towards their customers.
5) All mid range games ran well.

Cons:
1) Sometimes I observe a occasional lag when switching between apps or clicking the menu button.
2) The tab is a bit on heavier side although not that alarming.
3) High end games cannot run smoothly because of a lower end processor and poor GPU.
4) A bit awkward to hold because of the inbuilt stand but than that is what makes it stand apart from bunch of tablets.
5) No full control for Dolby Atmos.

These are some of the impressions I have after using it for full one day heavily. Its a definite buy if your budget is below 16k and you don't like that torture of ios and mind it its a hd screen and at a lower ppi so don't expect that crystal clear video playback as Sony Xperia Z5 premium or Galaxy s6 edge can do. Thanks for reading my review :)
In low price range, this tab comes with good configuration viz. dolby sound, 2gb Ram and 8MP camera is an excellent product to buy. Also the 6200 mAH power battery boost the excitement

They could have given some more of memory space. Finding suitable SD card for this is a real tough thing. So you need to rely on pendrives. The speed is like decent. Not that great. Other than these two, no complaints. Worth having.
Good battery life. But battery weight heavy on wrist while holding to read. Stand very useful but sharp edges. Good display. Good speed. Good for reading and browsing. Camera ok.
It's good , sound clarity is amazing and display is good compare to any other devices in price segment.

Definitely the best 8 inch budget tablet one can find in India due to:
1)Very strong build with premium look
2)The best: Battery lasts more than 2 days for an average user(reading, browsing, etc). It took 3 days to come to 40% of the battery in idle condition
3)Qualifies for 4G VoLTE
4)Very receptive and quick touch
5)Very little bloatware(from Lenovo) and is almost stock android(Lollipop)

Few Cons:
1)Finding accessories is a night mare. You will find most on Amazon India(Cheaper on eBay though).
2)Little bulky(obviously due to the bigger battery)
3)Marshmallow(6.0.1) in the tab would turn it into a dream machine(will save a lot of battery).

About the item: Dolby sound effects is pretty good. Rotatable camera does excellent job in good light. Great feelings with the battery life. No lag, hang so far. Nice display. Good grip for holding. Rugged construction.

Why 5 star and not 4. It's has been 3 years since I have been using it. Tough body and screen.
Pros are good display and Dolby sound. Battery is superb. Full charge and forget for 2-3 days with decent usage.

Cons- now it has become slow due to 2 gb ram. But when it was launched, it was fast and all prime , Netflix shows I used to watch. Still it works fine.

Looks is unmatched and once I took it to office, everyone wanted to try their hands on it.

Great product for a great price. Great battery life. Performance is good enough for the price. Jio 4G data works, but no VoLTE, but its OK for the price. Can't send messages via Jio, but receives without any issues. Very suitable for bank OTP purposes. Calls through other networks (3G/2G) works without any issue, but uses loud-speaker for calls, because there is no ear-piece. Audio through stereo speakers is AMAZING. Great for video consumption. Go for it guys...

Update: Got one charging problem in 10th month. Lenovo service centre for tablets in Madurai, just replaced the board for free. Hats off to their service as well.

Simply put, the Yoga Tab 3 8 inch (2GB RAM variant) is a very good tablet at this price point.

While there is the 1GB RAM variant available at a lower price on other e-Retailers, I would never recommend that as 2GB RAM is the bare minimum needed for this tablet to run without any hitches.

PROS:

First and foremost, there is the unique design with the cylindrical bulge at the side (or bottom depending upon the orientation you choose to hold it in)which is a very handy thing, once you get used to it. It gives you the ability to hold it comfortably in your hand, akin to holding a book by its binding.

It also houses a rotating camera, which is very cool, for it does away with the need for having separate front & rear facing cameras.

The integrated kick-stand is another useful thing, for it allows you to place the tablet on any flat surface, without having to rely on any external case or props.

Then, there is this excellent build quality. It's not among the lightest, but there is a reassuring heft to it, and it definitely doesn't feel plasticky or cheap.

The highlight of this tablet has to be it's exceptional battery life. On moderate to average use, the battery easily lasts for 3 days!

The display, at 1200 x 800 is not Full HD, but is very bright, and certainly acceptable given that the screen is only 8 inches. In fact, the display on this is better than the 10 inch variant of the Yoga Tab 3, since that also has the same 1200 x 800 resolution.

The next best feature of this tablet is the exceptionally good sound quality. These are Dolby Atmos speakers, and they certainly sound good, when watching movies or music videos. Also, the speakers are really well designed, and the machine-drilled fine holes for the speakers on cylinder exude a premium look, quite similar to the speaker grille design on the HTC One series of phones.

Contrary to the specifications published here on Flipkart, this variant now ships with Android 6.0 from the factory, so you need worry about having to upgrade from Lollipop to Marshmallow. Also, thankfully it doesn't come with as much bloatware now, as the older models used to ship with.

CONS:

Performance, though definitely better than the 1GB RAM variant, is still below par. Lenovo cleverly masks the fact that this uses a very basic Snapdragon 212 processor, by using the other name for it - MSM8909.

Since it's running a near stock version of Android 6.0, most day-to-day operations will seem OK to the casual user. However, the weakness of the extremely low-end Snapdragon 200-series processor starts coming to the fore, when you see the amount of time it takes to install apps from the Google Play Store. It just takes far too long to download & install updates, when compared to even the most entry level smart phones.

If only Lenovo had equipped this with a Snapdragon 400-series processor - even if it were for a couple of thousand bucks more!

Another area of weakness is the camera. While the swivel camera is a great (and very handy) design element, the camera consistently gives sub-par picture quality, and definitely doesn't make the cut in today's era. However, how many of us actually use a tablet to take pictures outdoors?

Despite the somewhat mediocre performance, and a sub-par camera, it still remains a very choice for it's superb build quality, battery life, and display - more so at the discounted price that it's available for during sales!

This is not a product review, have no issues with it. Flipkart not allowing me to review at the Samsung F22 page which got delivered today. Flipkart delivery time period as always is above par. However I am terribly DISAPPOINTED with their exchange policy. I bought Samsung F22 for exchange of my existing Asus Zenphone Max Pro 1 and the exchange value shown was Rs 3800.00 subject to minimum working conditions. When the delivery guy came, he checked all the parameters and it was found up to the mark but as if to find some faults deliberately, he showed me a tiny spot in the screen which I also did not notice as I am using this phone with no issues. In fact, I was to do a factory reset only after the new phone arrives as it is currently my working phone. There are 2 ways to look at it . Either the delivery guy has clear directions of not paying the entire agreed cost of exchange as it appeared to be pre-decided OR the second reason is he has no idea of what is checking. This is even dangerous as the reputation of mighty Company like Flipkart is in hands of such guys. I have never ever posted any negative reviews but I feel cheated and disappointed this time. I did read reviews that Flipkart has very poor exchange policy but did not believe and went ahead as my experience about buying new product is totally different. In the end I paid heavy price for blind trust. Lessons learnt. For all guys out there, if you want to buy a new phone with no exchange go ahead but DO NOT fall into the lucrative exchange prices. Does Flipkart expect us to exchange brand new phone with absolutely no minor scratches or issues? Wish they had better insight and had option of judgement of the exchange product by some expert than some pretty ordinary guy.

Ordered it on 26th october and got on 31st, so a satisfying delivery by flipkart. Since I am using it for almost 1 month, I am noting down those facts and issues about the tablet that I have experienced without any exaggeration.
Positive points:-
1. Played youtube videos with the official YouTube app by Google, and it took about 7 hours to discharge the battery from 97% to 21%.
2. Read pdfs continuously for 5 hours with XODO reader, battery went from 78% to about 56%.
3. Surfed internet(Facebook + The Hindu web + Gmail + Google search), it took 3 hours to discharge from 82% to 63%.
4. Played World Cricket Championship 2 by NextWave Multimedia, and in about 3 hours battery discharged from 89% to 41%.
5. Played Special Forces Group 2 by ForgeGames and it drained battery from 90% to 54% in an hour.
But what I need to mention here is I didn't installed battery draining apps like I) Facebook, II) WhatsApp, III)IMO, Even I am writing this review after installing Flipkart app minutes ago.
6. The tab is very easy to handle, as it's CG is towards the side of the kickstand, chances are low that you will drop it from hand providing you held it by the kickstand's side.
7. ppi of the screen is less than 200, but still 720p videos on youtube looks enough detailed.
8. Dolby Atmos makes the sound quality very classy. It feels like I am in a mini-theatre when I watch a cinema.
9. Once I dropped it totally bare(without screen guard or cover) from my hand by the side of the screen from about 6 inch above floor, still I only noticed very negligible scratches it made.
10. Once I fully charged it and just didn't use for about 12 hours. On unlocking the screen, all I noticed was the battery status which was stating that it has 99% battery left.
Now time for Negetive points:-
1. If multitasked for long time, battery heats up to 35℃, as shown by 360 security app.
2. It runs a Snapdragon 210 processor which sometimes make it hang a-bit, even if it has 2 Gigs of RAM.
3. 720p videos in YouTube some times run laggy.
4. When I charge this tablet keeping it on(not power off), it becomes heated up after charging for about 2 hours. But when charged keeping the power off, this issue get eliminated.
5. Although it is 4G enabled, this doesn't have the VoLTE( Voice over LTE) technology. So if you use a a connection like Reliance JIO which is totally 4G band based, you won't be able to call or message anyone with tablet's default keypad or messaging app. But you can do this with Jio4GVoice(previously JioJoin) in case of Reliance Jio connection, which require you to have your mobile data on while calling or messaging others.
6. Though the camera of this tablet is tagged 8 MP, it would disappoint you if you loves to take pictures(not me), but does well job while video calling.

Last line:- Lenovo Yoga Tab 3 - 850M with 4G and 2 GB RAM is for those, who 1) loves to read a lot, may be offline or online,(Amazon Kindle app designed for tablets works well), 2) Draw or Write digitally(don't forget about AnyPen technology, it works with every sharp end conducting material), 3)Happy with low end games, 4) Wants to enjoy a whole night watching movie online, 5)Want to have an almost stock like Interface, 6) Love to surf the web and new blogs, websites every now and then.
Some suggestions from me:-
1. It comes with MacAfee antivirus with 1 months free subscription. You better uninstall it and use 360 antivirus(free), because MacAfee sometimes makes it slow while protecting web.
2. Have a screen protector which is "Matte" otherwise light may refelect of the screen a lot during day time, making it a bit harder to carry on reading PDFs with it.
3. Using a cover on it may protect it physically, but it is designed in such a way the handling it with a cover makes it feel heavier. So my suggestion is instead of using a frame like cover, use a bag like case, so when you carry it , you keep it safely inside the case, and when you want to use it, take it out and use. It will make you handle it easier.

It's all I have experienced. Now decision is yours. Have a good BUY.
Update: It's been more than 4 months of use and I wanna add some points here.
I) I've tried many games in past 2 months, and I have to admit that despite having a Snapdragon 210 this tablet provides pretty impressive performance. Most of the games(Oddworld:Strangers wrath, Star Wars:KOTOR, N.O.V.A.3, ShadowGun deadzone, Bullet force, Modern strike, Critical Ops, XCOM:Enemy within, GTA:CTW) runs well,really well. But games like GTA:SA & VC , MC5:Blackout dropped framerate, giving me a bad experience. They are playable with sacrificed graphics(Not MC5).
II) I am constantly facing a brightness problem now a days. When at night I read something with brightness kept lowest, suddenly it automatically goes high(I always set brightness manually), making my eyes pissed off. Same thing happens at daytime, when brightness automatically goes down making me annoyed. Though it seldom happens, still irritating.

-2 stars
- Data via jio sim constantly fluctuates making calling via jio4gvoice app completely impossible, even a coolpad note 3 lite does a better job in consistancy

+3 stars
- Amazing sound quality/clearity & loudness, i cancelled my bluetooth speakers's order after listening to these speakers.
- Good battery life
